content:
• Wednesday, February 1, 2012
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee (NASDAQ:GMCR) is now up 21% AH after blowing away FQ1 estimates and...

    Green Mountain Coffee (NASDAQ:GMCR) is now up 21% AH after blowing away FQ1 estimates and reiterating its FY12 guidance. Green Mountain's results were fueled by increases of 115% and 76%, respectively, in K-Cup and brewer/accesory sales, and a 410 bps Y/Y increase in its gross margin to 29.1%. Also of note is a 10% Q/Q drop in Green Mountain's inventories, whose growth was seen as a red flag. JVA +9.4% in sympathy.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:50 PM | 4 Comments
  • RA-OLD

    RailAmerica (NYSE:RA-OLD) gains 4.3% AH after commencing a tender offer to purchase $444M worth...

    RailAmerica (NYSE:RA-OLD) gains 4.3% AH after commencing a tender offer to purchase $444M worth of 9.25% senior notes due 2017, for a total consideration of $1,120 per $1,000 of principal. The railroad operator also says it's spending $40M to acquire Marquette Rail, and $18M to acquire a 70% stake in the Wellsboro and Corning railroad.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:33 PM
  • GTATQ

    More on GT Advanced Technologies' (GTAT) FQ3: The maker of solar manufacturing gear reiterates...

    More on GT Advanced Technologies' (GTAT) FQ3: The maker of solar manufacturing gear reiterates its FY12 revenue guidance range of $950M-$1.05B, but is slightly lowering EPS guidance to $1.45-$1.60 from a prior $1.45-$1.65. GT, which had no debt at quarter's end, also says it obtained a $175M credit facility and a $75M term loan facility. GTAT -5.8% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • RLD

    More on RealD (NYSE:RLD): FQ3 blows out EPS estimates despite a Y/Y decline in revenue, as...

    More on RealD (NYSE:RLD): FQ3 blows out EPS estimates despite a Y/Y decline in revenue, as margins soar from 11% to 49% on better management of its operating expenses. Shares +10.1% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:56 PM
  • NG

    NovaGold Resources (NYSEMKT:NG) sells a 26.4M share block of stock to a syndicate of...

    NovaGold Resources (NYSEMKT:NG) sells a 26.4M share block of stock to a syndicate of underwriters, led by RBC and JP Morgan, for $9.50 per share. The sales will result in gross proceeds to NovaGold of approximately $251M, for which the underwriters will then turn around and sell the shares to the public. Shares -7.4% AH and currently halted.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM | 2 Comments
  • VIAV

    More on JDS Uniphase's FQ2: The company expects FQ3 revenue of $410M-$425M, compared with a...

    More on JDS Uniphase's FQ2: The company expects FQ3 revenue of $410M-$425M, compared with a $418M consensus. Optical component sales for the telecom market fell 18% Y/Y, and test & measurement equipment sales fell 15%. However, commercial laser sales rose 11%. Each of its business units saw a book-to-bill ratio above 1 in FQ2. JDSU +6.6% AH. FNSR +3.8% in sympathy. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM
  • EDMC

    More on Education Management (NASDAQ:EDMC) FQ2 beats on a per share basis but misses on revenue....

    More on Education Management (NASDAQ:EDMC) FQ2 beats on a per share basis but misses on revenue. Net revenues declined Y/Y, driven by a 4.5% drop in October 2011 student enrollment. Shares -1.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:33 PM
  • EDMC

    Education Management (NASDAQ:EDMC): FQ2 EPS of $0.49 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $737.2M (-4.5%...

    Education Management (NASDAQ:EDMC): FQ2 EPS of $0.49 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $737.2M (-4.5% Y/Y) misses by $10M. Shares -1.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM
  • SD

    Just when you think you understand what CEO Tom Ward has planned for Sandridge Energy (NYSE:SD)...

    Just when you think you understand what CEO Tom Ward has planned for Sandridge Energy (NYSE:SD) shareholders, he throws you another curve. This time he is making a big offshore acquisition. The deal includes $680M of cash, something Sandridge is flush with. Shares -11.2% AH. (submitted by Devon Shire)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • CNQR

    More on Concur Technologies (NASDAQ:CNQR): FQ1 easily beats estimates across the board. Revenue...

    More on Concur Technologies (NASDAQ:CNQR): FQ1 easily beats estimates across the board. Revenue jumped 25% Y/Y as the company continues to see strong customer demand in its core business. The company also issues a bullish forecast for 2012, saying it expects sales to rise by 25.5% from the previous year, and FQ2 EPS should be $1.27. Street analysts are expecting an EPS of $0.83. Shares +1.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM
  • ATW

    Atwood Oceanics (NYSE:ATW): FQ1 EPS of $1.00 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $184.7M (+26.2% Y/Y)...

    Atwood Oceanics (NYSE:ATW): FQ1 EPS of $1.00 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $184.7M (+26.2% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -2.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:25 PM
  • ABCO

    Advisory Board Company (NASDAQ:ABCO): FQ3 EPS of $0.61 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $100M (+33%...

    Advisory Board Company (NASDAQ:ABCO): FQ3 EPS of $0.61 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $100M (+33% Y/Y) beats by $1.8M. Shares +2.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 PM
  • CMG

    More on Chipotle Mexican Grill (NYSE:CMG): Q4 EPS missed the mark as material costs for food,...

    More on Chipotle Mexican Grill (NYSE:CMG): Q4 EPS missed the mark as material costs for food, beverage and packaging rose 28% Y/Y. The company also predicts that same-store sales growth will abate in 2012, coming in the single-digits versus 11% for the year prior period. Shares -1.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM
  • ZNGA

    More from Facebook's S-1: No details are provided on the expected IPO valuation. R&D...

    More from Facebook's S-1: No details are provided on the expected IPO valuation. R&D spending rose 169% Y/Y in 2011 to $388M, while SG&A spending rose 132% to $707M - both figures easily outpace revenue growth. The company claims 845M monthly active users (MAUs) as of year's end (+39% Y/Y), and 425M mobile MAUs. Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) represented 12% of Facebook's 2011 revenue. ZNGA +2.8% AH. (S-1 filing)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • CNQR

    Concur Technologies (NASDAQ:CNQR): FQ1 EPS of $0.30 may not be comparable to consensus to $0.19....

    Concur Technologies (NASDAQ:CNQR): FQ1 EPS of $0.30 may not be comparable to consensus to $0.19. Revenue of $100.4M (+25.1% Y/Y) beats by $1.4M. Shares +1.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM
  • CACI

    CACI International (NYSE:CACI): FQ2 EPS of $2.00 may not be comparable with consensus of $1.32....

    CACI International (NYSE:CACI): FQ2 EPS of $2.00 may not be comparable with consensus of $1.32. Revenue of $973.2M (+12.2% Y/Y) beats by $21M. Shares +4.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM
  • BMC

    More on BMC Software's FQ3: BMC's R&D and SG&A expenses both fell Y/Y, helping earnings...

    More on BMC Software's FQ3: BMC's R&D and SG&A expenses both fell Y/Y, helping earnings beat estimates in spite of the revenue miss. The decline in bookings is due to a 23% Y/Y drop for BMC's ESM server management software unit, which has struggled with sales execution issues. The price for BMC's acquisition of Numara Software is disclosed to be $300M. BMC -1.1% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • GMCR

    More from GMCR's FQ1 report: Guides to FQ2 EPS of $0.60-0.65 vs. $0.73. Sees revenue growth of...

    More from GMCR's FQ1 report: Guides to FQ2 EPS of $0.60-0.65 vs. $0.73. Sees revenue growth of 45%-50% for the coming quarter and 60%-65% for the full year. Sales of K-cup packs $715.7M, up 81%; brewers and accessories $330.4M. Shares have resumed trading, +6.1% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM | 1 Comment
  • QCOM

    More on Qualcomm's FQ1: Shipped 156M MSM baseband chips, up 32% Y/Y. Expects 146M-154M MSM...

    More on Qualcomm's FQ1: Shipped 156M MSM baseband chips, up 32% Y/Y. Expects 146M-154M MSM shipments in FQ2, up 24-31% Y/Y. Collected royalties on 191M-195M devices at ASP of $212-$218, up from FQ4's $204-$210 thanks to strong smartphone sales. Sees FY12 device ASP of $204-$216. Ended quarter with $22B in cash and investments. QCOM +4.7% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • EA

    More on Electronic Arts (NASDAQ:EA): FQ3 beats estimates on both EPS and revenue due to strong...

    More on Electronic Arts (NASDAQ:EA): FQ3 beats estimates on both EPS and revenue due to strong sales of new videogame releases, including the highly anticipated Star Wars: The Old Republic. However, the company cuts its forecast for FQ4, now saying that earnings will come in around $0.10 - $0.20, below Wall Street expectations of $0.30. Shares -4.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • CELL

    Brightpoint (NASDAQ:CELL): Q4 EPS of $0.34 in-line. Revenue of $1.56B (+38.9% Y/Y) beats by...

    Brightpoint (NASDAQ:CELL): Q4 EPS of $0.34 in-line. Revenue of $1.56B (+38.9% Y/Y) beats by $170M. Shares -5.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • ACMP

    Shares of Cherokee Midstream Partners (CHKM) move down 4.2% in AH trading after the firm...

    Shares of Cherokee Midstream Partners (CHKM) move down 4.2% in AH trading after the firm announces a secondary public offering of 9.25M common units owned by Global Infrastructure Partners.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • QCOM

    Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM): FQ1 EPS of $.97 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $4.68B (+40% Y/Y) beats by...

    Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM): FQ1 EPS of $.97 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $4.68B (+40% Y/Y) beats by $100M. Expects FQ2 revenue of $4.6B-$5B and EPS of $0.91-$0.97, above consensus of $4.5B and $0.89. Expects FY12 revenue of $18.7B-$19.7B and EPS of $3.55-$3.75, mostly above consensus of $18.48B and $3.59. Shares +3.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • CLGX

    Shares of CoreLogic (CLGX -1.2%) spike lower by 6% off of a report that a planned leveraged...

    Shares of CoreLogic (CLGX -1.2%) spike lower by 6% off of a report that a planned leveraged buyout may be stuck in neutral before recovering some ground in the last 30 minutes of trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • CYT

    Cytec Industries (CYT +14.3%) is among the day's top gainers after the maker of reinforced...

    Cytec Industries (CYT +14.3%) is among the day's top gainers after the maker of reinforced plastics used in airplanes says it hired J.P. Morgan to review options for the “separation” of its coating resins business. The company expects to make a decision on the unit by Q2 2012. (Q4 earnings, conf. call)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM
  • C

    Wells Fargo raises Citigroup (C +3.2%) to Outperform from Market Perform, citing improved...

    Wells Fargo raises Citigroup (C +3.2%) to Outperform from Market Perform, citing improved operating leverage, increased capital flexibility and repurchases, and a valuation near the bottom of its peers. The firm also lifts First Horizon (FHN +2%) to Outperform, as aggressive cost reductions should generate materially stronger pre-provision net revenue expansion than peers.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM

  • W.R. Grace (GRA, +2.5%) gains after its Q4 beats across the board. Profit jumped 29% as the...

    W.R. Grace (GRA, +2.5%) gains after its Q4 beats across the board. Profit jumped 29% as the company was able to pass through higher prices for its products and preserve sales growth. The results came a day after the specialty-chemical company won federal court approval of its plan to exit a 10-year bankruptcy stay.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM
  • WRB

    Niche property-and-casualty insurer W.R. Berkley (WRB +6.1%) trades higher after its Q4 beat...

    Niche property-and-casualty insurer W.R. Berkley (WRB +6.1%) trades higher after its Q4 beat analysts' expectations earlier today on strong premium growth. Net premiums written increased 19% Y/Y on improving coverage demand, but losses and loss expenses also increased 17%, which mitigated some of the gains.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM
  • AET

    Aetna (AET +3.8%) CFO Joe Zubretsky says the company could make acquisitions larger than the...

    Aetna (AET +3.8%) CFO Joe Zubretsky says the company could make acquisitions larger than the $1.35B currently earmarked as deployable capital and isn't picky about who it tries to snap up. "We are looking for anything that’s in our strategic plan, including Medicare, Medicaid, building out technology and engaging the consumer."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM
  • WHR

    At least one analyst, Virtual Research's Jeff Sprague, isn't buying all the optimism at...

    At least one analyst, Virtual Research's Jeff Sprague, isn't buying all the optimism at Whirlpool (WHR +17.8%), given that in 2012 the company must pay $275M in a Brazilian legal settlement, $110M for anti-trust resolutions, $250M in pension contributions and $279M in restructuring cash outlays. Targets look "extremely optimistic... We reiterate our Sell Rating."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM | 4 Comments
  • KAMN

    Aircraft component maker Kaman (KAMN +3.8%) rallies after announcing it received a $24.2M...

    Aircraft component maker Kaman (KAMN +3.8%) rallies after announcing it received a $24.2M follow-on order to supply joint programmable fuzes ((JPFs)), which allow a plane's weapons settings to be controlled, to the U.S. Air Force. Kaman, the sole supplier of JPFs to 24 countries, says its total backlog for the product stands at $149.2M.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM
  • LQDT

    Liquidity Services (LQDT +2.2%) bounces back from early losses after its FQ1 results easily beat...

    Liquidity Services (LQDT +2.2%) bounces back from early losses after its FQ1 results easily beat analysts' expectations. The stock had dipped out of the gate after the company's reduced FQ2 outlook for adjusted earnings fell short of the Street's consensus view.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • WBSN

    Wells Fargo doesn't like what it sees in Websense's (WBSN -6.2%) lowered 2012 forecast, cutting...

    Wells Fargo doesn't like what it sees in Websense's (WBSN -6.2%) lowered 2012 forecast, cutting the shares to Market Perform on the news. Wells says guidance was weak across virtually all metrics: revenue, billings, operating margins, EPS and cash flow. Separately, First Analysis also downgrades the shares on a poor billing growth outlook.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • MCPIQ

    Shares of Molycorp (MCP -1.5%) retreat after JPMorgan issues cautionary comments on the deal to...

    Shares of Molycorp (MCP -1.5%) retreat after JPMorgan issues cautionary comments on the deal to take on an investment from Molymet. Analyst Michael Gambardella questions the timing of the cash infusion without any obvious use for it by the rare earth miner.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM | 3 Comments
  • JACK

    Jack In The Box (JACK +3.6%) gets a boost from Lazard Capital initiating the shares with a Buy...

    Jack In The Box (JACK +3.6%) gets a boost from Lazard Capital initiating the shares with a Buy this morning, noting that same-store sales trends should continue to improve given pricing initiatives, new menu additions, a menu board redesign and store remodeling.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • NAV

    Navistar International (NAV +6%) trades up despite projecting during its Analyst Day today that...

    Navistar International (NAV +6%) trades up despite projecting during its Analyst Day today that adjusted earnings for FY12 would be below analysts' estimates. Despite the miss, it says profit from truck and engine manufacturing should increase by 13% to 30% this year, and sales of commercial trucks will likely rise by 5% to 18% over 2011.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM
  • MGAM

    Casino gaming system maker Multimedia Games (MGAM +31.8%) soars to new 52-week highs after...

    Casino gaming system maker Multimedia Games (MGAM +31.8%) soars to new 52-week highs after reporting FQ1 revenue of $34.8M (+22% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.21, trouncing Street estimates by $3.8M and $0.17. The company attributes the strong results to growing sales of new systems in several states. It's also lifting its FY12 EPS guidance range to $0.42-$0.45, well above a prior range of $0.23-$0.26.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • TMO

    Thermo Fisher (TMO +2.3%) gains after its Q4 beat estimates on better-than-expected revenue and...

    Thermo Fisher (TMO +2.3%) gains after its Q4 beat estimates on better-than-expected revenue and improved gross margins. The company's laboratory products and services segment - its largest top-line contributor - saw a 5% revenue increase, while its analytical technologies segment's and specialty diagnostics segments also gained market share.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM
  • USB

    UBS adds U.S. Bancorp (USB +1.7%) to its Key Call List - a designation that comes replete with a...

    UBS adds U.S. Bancorp (USB +1.7%) to its Key Call List - a designation that comes replete with a Buy rating. Analysts call the bank's model the "most optimal" in the sector and see USB's trend of outperformance over the last 10 years extending into the future.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM | 1 Comment

  • Shares of Hudson Valley Holding (HVB) lose 21% after the bank holding company gets clipped by...

    Shares of Hudson Valley Holding (HVB) lose 21% after the bank holding company gets clipped by analysts at Stifel with a downgrade to Hold from Buy on the heels of a weaker-than-expected Q4 earnings report. The company announced a $0.18/share quarterly dividend as part of its report, but warned future payouts will be capped.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM | 2 Comments
  • WHR

    Whirlpool (WHR +18%) soars despite Q4 revenues missing estimates earlier today. Net profit...

    Whirlpool (WHR +18%) soars despite Q4 revenues missing estimates earlier today. Net profit jumped 20% Y/Y as the appliance maker cut costs and saw sales improve in North America. What's driving the shares today is the company's better than anticipated FY12 guidance. It now expects FY12 EPS to be around $6.50 to $7.00 ex-special items, far above the Street view of $5.85.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • WMT

    It's a 10-year high for Wal-Mart (WMT +1.9%) which takes out its September 2008 level of $62.41....

    It's a 10-year high for Wal-Mart (WMT +1.9%) which takes out its September 2008 level of $62.41. The next stops are March 2002's $63.75 and the all-time high near $70 hit in late 1999.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM | 1 Comment
  • TUP

    Holding close to flat despite missing on earnings, Tupperware (TUP -4.4%) gives it up after...

    Holding close to flat despite missing on earnings, Tupperware (TUP -4.4%) gives it up after getting downgraded to Equalweight from Overweight by Morgan Stanley.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • GFA-OLD

    Shares in Brazilian construction company Gafisa SA (GFA-OLD +9%) pop amid persistent speculation...

    Shares in Brazilian construction company Gafisa SA (GFA-OLD +9%) pop amid persistent speculation that an undisclosed investment fund may be preparing a takeover bid. The stock is up nearly 30% over the past six sessions in volatile trading as takeout chatter has increased.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM
  • COCO

    Corinthian Colleges (COCO +32.3%) soars to the top of the Nasdaq charts after swinging to a...

    Corinthian Colleges (COCO +32.3%) soars to the top of the Nasdaq charts after swinging to a profit in its FQ2 and reporting progress in slowing the pace of declining enrollments. COCO forecasts current-quarter EPS and revenue above consensus. Shares of other for-profit education firms jump, including CECO +8.9%, STRA +6%, DV +3.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • JDAS

    JDA Software's (JDAS -17.5%) post-earnings selloff, fueled by software sales weakness, a lack of...

    JDA Software's (JDAS -17.5%) post-earnings selloff, fueled by software sales weakness, a lack of 2012 guidance, and (especially) the company's disclosure of an SEC investigation, has gone from bad to worse. During its earnings call, JDA said it received both a comment letter and a subpoena from the SEC over the timing of revenue recognition, but added the existence of the revenue isn't being questioned.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • ST

    Sensata Technologies (ST +6%) rallies after beating reduced Q4 estimates earlier today. The...

    Sensata Technologies (ST +6%) rallies after beating reduced Q4 estimates earlier today. The company had previously warned of a weak quarter due to flooding in Thailand, lower production levels and higher restructuring costs. The worst appears to be behind it, as the maker of sensor products for the automotive and aircraft industry also reafirms on the higher side of Q1 guidance as well.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • PBEGF

    Petrobank Energy (OTCPK:PBEGF +5.3%) shares pop following the company's sale of its May River...

    Petrobank Energy (OTCPK:PBEGF +5.3%) shares pop following the company's sale of its May River oil sands assets for $225M. This leaves Petrobank with a large net cash position, perhaps making investors wonder if a spin-out of subsidiary Petrobakken (PBKEF.PK) won't soon follow. (submitted by Devon Shire)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • ATHX

    Microcap biotech research firm Athersys (ATHX +8%) jumps after disclosing $3.6M in grant funding...

    Microcap biotech research firm Athersys (ATHX +8%) jumps after disclosing $3.6M in grant funding to further advance its MultiStem product research and development programs and other cell therapy platforms.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM
  • DSPG

    DSP Group (DSPG +4.2%) is trading higher this morning after its Q4 beat estimates, if only...

    DSP Group (DSPG +4.2%) is trading higher this morning after its Q4 beat estimates, if only slightly, and the wireless chipset provider ups its FY12 revenue guidance to between $200M - $220M, above analysts consensus of $195M. The company says its channel inventory depletion cycle appears to be behind it, and is poised for significant growth from a promising pipeline of design wins from new market verticals.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • AMZN

    In spite of Amazon's (AMZN -8.6%) revenue weakness and selloff, e-commerce peers eBay (EBAY...

    In spite of Amazon's (AMZN -8.6%) revenue weakness and selloff, e-commerce peers eBay (EBAY +2.3%) and Groupon (GRPN +3.6%) are actually outperforming the NASDAQ today. The gains could be evidence the Street believes Amazon's woes are company-specific and/or have much to do with a mix shift towards third-party retailers. (more on AMZN)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • AOL

    Shares of AOL trade 14% higher - hitting a 6-month high - after the firm reports Q4 profit fell...

    Shares of AOL trade 14% higher - hitting a 6-month high - after the firm reports Q4 profit fell less than expected. Investors seem to be honing in on the 15% Y/Y gain in display advertising - a segment seen as vital to the firm's future.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • AMZN

    Amazon (AMZN -9.2%) remains sharply lower following its revenue miss and soft guidance. Stifel...

    Amazon (AMZN -9.2%) remains sharply lower following its revenue miss and soft guidance. Stifel and Collins Stewart are worried a growing reliance on third-party retailers bears much responsibility for the top-line weakness, while Canaccord notes shipping and fulfillment costs again outgrew sales. So did hiring, which Barb Darrow thinks may have something to do with the needs of the web services business. (more) (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM | 1 Comment
  • END

    Endeavor International Corp (END +3.8%) trades up after announcing a private placement to issue...

    Endeavor International Corp (END +3.8%) trades up after announcing a private placement to issue up to $500M in new senior notes due 2020. Net proceeds of the offering will go to fund its previously announced acquisition of oilfield interests in the U.K. North Sea as well as paying down senior term loans due next year.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • PPO

    Shares of Polypore International (NYSE:PPO) recover 12% after getting run over a bus (I, II)...

    Shares of Polypore International (NYSE:PPO) recover 12% after getting run over a bus (I, II) yesterday amid a 30% selloff tied to the potential loss of a major customer. Analysts are helping prop up the rally with positive comments out from Needham, BB&T, and Stifel.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • SVNTQ

    Savient Pharmaceuticals (SVNT -12.6%) shares plunge after Dendreon (DNDN +4.6%) swipes its CEO,...

    Savient Pharmaceuticals (SVNT -12.6%) shares plunge after Dendreon (DNDN +4.6%) swipes its CEO, as John Johnson will take the helm at DNDN on June 30 after only one year at SVNT. Deutsche Bank says Johnson has a history of M&A and his fresh perspective might benefit DNDN's near-term strategy, noting his success in selling Imclone to Eli Lilly and attempts to sell SVNT.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM | 1 Comment
  • SLGN

    Silgan Holdings (SLGN +2.5%) bounces back from heavy losses at the open to trade higher after...

    Silgan Holdings (SLGN +2.5%) bounces back from heavy losses at the open to trade higher after its Q4 beat estimates late yesterday. Profit rose 19% Y/Y on higher net volumes from recent acquisitions and the pass-through of raw material costs, which offset lower unit volumes in its plastic packaging and single-serve beverage segments.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • WBSN

    Shares of Websense (WBSN -7.4%) lose ground after the firm sets top-line FY12 guidance below...

    Shares of Websense (WBSN -7.4%) lose ground after the firm sets top-line FY12 guidance below that of the estimate by analysts. The tech concern sees Q1 revenue of $88M-$91M vs. $92.2M consensus, and FY12 revenue of $364M-$374M vs. $379.5M consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • STP

    Chinese solar module vendor Suntech Power (STP +4%) trades higher after striking a partnership...

    Chinese solar module vendor Suntech Power (STP +4%) trades higher after striking a partnership with DuPont (DD) that will cover technology development, cost-reduction efforts, and marketing, as well as the supply of DuPont's Tedlar solar film for use in Suntech's modules.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM

    Seagate (STX +15.8%) soars to levels not seen since 2007 after beating FQ2 estimates and guiding...
